result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cedrick Dion Green

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cedrick Dion Green not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Cedrick Dion Green.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requests a resolution date. Court authorized the defendant to appear via zoom from Racine CI on the next court date. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 12 pages) commencing 08-10-2022 by Irene Koenigs.

Defendant Cedrick Dion Green in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Defendant Cedrick Dion Green in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee County Sheriff Sgt. T. Reymer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Cedrick Dion Green not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant is unavailable for todays proceedings due to a medical appointment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, appear by video. Defendant Cedrick Dion Green not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Defendant is currently housed at the Racine Jail. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Cedrick Dion Green in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Cedrick Dion Green in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
